comments: Same digital roots as A065075 (sum of digits of the sum of the preceding numbers) and A004207 (sum of digits of all previous terms); they enter into the cycle {1 2 4 8 7 5}. - _Alexandre Wajnberg_, Dec 11 2005It is believed that a(n) ~ n*9*log_10(2)/2, but this is an open problem.
references: N. J. A. Sloane, A Handbook of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1973 (includes this sequence).
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Zak Seidov, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
